docs.snippet: The presidential election underscores a problem for the tech industry: that a small group of people designs products the entire world uses, perhaps stifling diversity of thought.

headline.main: Farhad’s and Mike’s Week in Tech: When the Tech Industry Lives in a Bubble

docs.snippet: A video on the mayor’s City Hall Twitter account uses two Broadway stars to promote his accomplishments. Some say it is too much like a campaign ad.

headline.print_headline: Song for de Blasio on Twitter Sounds Sour Note for Government Watchdogs
headline.main: A Song for Bill de Blasio Sounds a Sour Note for Watchdogs

docs.snippet: The bombs shake the house at night and blow open doors and windows. How can a father explain war to his children?

headline.print_headline: In Yemen, ‘We Sleep Afraid, We Wake Up Afraid’
headline.main: ‘We Sleep Afraid, We Wake Up Afraid’: A Child’s Life in Yemen

docs.abstract: Journalist Mohammed al-Asaadi describes fear that pervades his household in Sana, Yemen, as bombings confine his family to apartment; says conflict has been especially hard on his four children.

docs.snippet: Hundreds of Muslims prayed next to Rome's Colosseum on Friday to protest against the closure of makeshift mosques, calling on city authorities to protect their religious rights.

headline.print_headline: Muslims Pray at Colosseum, Protesting Against Rome Mosque Closures
headline.main: Muslims Pray at Colosseum, Protesting Against Rome Mosque Closures

docs.snippet: Ms. Keys and Ms. Morris join voices. And Valery Gergiev leads the Mariinsky Orchestra in Stravinsky’s long-lost “Funeral Song.”

headline.main: What’s on TV Friday: Alicia Keys and Maren Morris on ‘CMT Crossroads’

docs.snippet: Our Top 10 Comments of the Week: Readers debate Trump’s Cabinet appointments, the death of astronaut John Glenn and the extent of Russian doping.

headline.main: ‘Might Does Not Make Right; Being in the Right Does.’

docs.snippet: Rodney Smith Jr. saw something last year that changed his life: An elderly person cutting grass in the heat of a sweltering Alabama summer.

headline.print_headline: Q&A: Alabama College Student on Free Lawn Care Service
headline.main: Q&A: Alabama College Student on Free Lawn Care Service

docs.snippet: Al Davis Jr. cracks a smile as he spots a speck of gold glittering in a plastic pan full of muck pulled from a Vermont brook, revealing a gold tooth made from some earlier finds.

headline.print_headline: Eureka! A New Generation of Gold Miners Heads for the Hills
headline.main: Eureka! A New Generation of Gold Miners Heads for the Hills

docs.snippet: Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. had a student's sports column pulled from the school's newspaper because it focused on vulgar comments made by Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump and the notion of "locker room talk."

headline.print_headline: Anti-Trump Column Pulled From Liberty U Student Newspaper
headline.main: Anti-Trump Column Pulled From Liberty U Student Newspaper
